Package org.jsimpledb

Abstraction layer allowing access to a Database using normal Java objects.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    JObject
    Interface implemented by JSimpleDB Java model objects.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Counter
    Represents a 64-bit counter value that can be adjusted concurrently by multiple transactions without locking.
    JClass<T>
    Information about a Java class that is used to represent a specific JSimpleDB object type.
    JCollectionField
    Represents a collection field in a JClass.
    JComplexField
    Represents a complex field in a JClass.
    JCounterField
    Represents a counter field in a JClass.
    JField
    Represents a field in a Java model object.
    JListField
    Represents a list field in a JClass.
    JMapField
    Represents a map field in a JClass.
    JReferenceField
    Represents a reference field in a JClass or a reference sub-field of a complex field in a JClass.
    JSchemaObject
    Superclass for the JClass and JField classes which constitute a JSimpleDB.
    JSetField
    Represents a set field in a JClass.
    JSimpleDB
    Abstraction layer allowing access to a Database using normal Java objects.
    JSimpleField
    Represents a simple field in a JClass or a simple sub-field of a complex field in a JClass.
    JTransaction
    A transaction associated with a JSimpleDB instance.
    ListIndexEntry<T>
    Returned by queries into the indexes assocated with list fields.
    MapKeyIndexEntry<T,V>
    Returned by queries into the indexes assocated with map field keys.
    MapValueIndexEntry<T,K>
    Returned by queries into the indexes assocated with map field values.
    ReferencePath
    Reference paths.
    SnapshotJTransaction
    An initially empty, in-memory JTransaction that persists indefinitely.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    ValidationMode
    Describes whether and how objects are validated within a JTransaction.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    ValidationException
    Thrown when JTransaction.validate() (or JTransaction.commit()) fails due to one or more validation errors.

Package org.jsimpledb Description

Abstraction layer allowing access to a Database using normal Java objects.
See Also:
JSimpleDB, Database, The JSimpleDB Project
